original: @63a ` // bdud btul ba la bstod pa bzhugs /
analyzed: @63a ` // bdud btul ba la bstod pa bzhugs /
translated: Praise of the Subjugation of Mara

original: # // dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: # // dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels.ðŸ”½What did you intend, O Sage, by opening your eyes for a moment,

original: bsam gtan phyin ci log gis ci zhig dgongs mdzad skad cig @63b legs par spyan dbye gzigs //
analyzed: bsam gtan phyin ci log gis ci zhig dgongs mdzad skad cig @63b legs par spyan dbye gzigs //
translated: as if struck by an invisible arrow?

original: lus med mda' yis gzir ba'i skye bo bdag cag skyob pas kyang ni bsrung bar mi mdzad na //
analyzed: lus med mda' yis gzir ba'i skye bo bdag cag skyob pas kyang ni bsrung bar mi mdzad na //
translated: Even those who protect us do not protect us from that which is inevitable.

original: thugs rje ldan pa phyin ci log gyur khyod las mchog tu ma rung skyes bu gzhan ma mchis //
analyzed: thugs rje ldan pa phyin ci log gyur khyod las mchog tu ma rung skyes bu gzhan ma mchis //
translated: O Compassionate One, there is no other man more unfortunate than you, who have become subject to the inevitable.

original: phrag dog ldan pa bdud kyi bud med de skad smra yang rgyal ba skyob pa byang chub gyur //
analyzed: phrag dog ldan pa bdud kyi bud med de skad smra yang rgyal ba skyob pa byang chub gyur //
translated: Though Mara's women, who are full of jealousy, spoke thus, the Victorious One, the Protector, attained enlightenment.

original: gzhan yang 'dod dbang gis ni kun du gzhu bkang bdud gzhan lag par myur pa pa ta ha sgra 'jebs dang ldan //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dod dbang gis ni kun du gzhu bkang bdud gzhan lag par myur pa pa ta ha sgra 'jebs dang ldan //
translated: Moreover, others, under the sway of desire, quickly took up their bows and arrows, and the sound of pataha drums.

original: dpa' bo smin ma bskyod dang nyer g-yo lta bur sgeg dang 'dzum dang rol pa med rnams kyis //
analyzed: dpa' bo smin ma bskyod dang nyer g-yo lta bur sgeg dang 'dzum dang rol pa med rnams kyis //
translated: The hero, with his eyebrows slightly raised, his eyes slightly moving, his face slightly smiling, and his body slightly shaking,

original: thub dbang skyob pa byang chub ma brnyes par du bsam gtan las ni bskyod ma nus pa mthong gyur nas //
analyzed: thub dbang skyob pa byang chub ma brnyes par du bsam gtan las ni bskyod ma nus pa mthong gyur nas //
translated: Seeing that the Lord of Sages, the Protector, was not to be moved from his meditation until he had attained enlightenment,

original: ngo mtshar gyur pas pa spu langs pa'i lus kyis grub pa rnams dang yan lag mchog rnams 'dud //
analyzed: ngo mtshar gyur pas pa spu langs pa'i lus kyis grub pa rnams dang yan lag mchog rnams 'dud //
translated: the Siddhas and the foremost of the gods bowed their heads to him, their bodies bristling with wonder.

original: ral pa 'khrugs shing lce rnams g-yogs la kun du bltams pas gang gi thugs rnams 'khrul par ma gyur cing //
analyzed: ral pa 'khrugs shing lce rnams g-yogs la kun du bltams pas gang gi thugs rnams 'khrul par ma gyur cing //
translated: Their hair dishevelled, their tongues lolling, they looked around, lest the Lord's mind should be disturbed.ðŸ”½The hosts of Mara, the Lord of Desire, were numerous as the grass, with their foremost of elephants and horses, with their faces of lions and tigers,

original: rab gsal 'dod lha'i bdud rnams rtse mo mchog dag lag thogs glang po rta rnams gdong ldan seng ge dang // stag gi gdong rnams rtsva bzhin grangs med gyur pa 'khor ba yis ni gang zhig bsnyengs par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: rab gsal 'dod lha'i bdud rnams rtse mo mchog dag lag thogs glang po rta rnams gdong ldan seng ge dang // stag gi gdong rnams rtsva bzhin grangs med gyur pa 'khor ba yis ni gang zhig bsnyengs par ma gyur pa //

original: de ni kun la gnod pa'i rnam pa 'dres pa med par skyob pa sangs rgyas thub dbang 'jig rten mgon //
analyzed: de ni kun la gnod pa'i rnam pa 'dres pa med par skyob pa sangs rgyas thub dbang 'jig rten mgon //
translated: He is the Protector, the Buddha, the Lord of Sages, the Lord of the World, who is not mixed with all that is harmful.

original: bdud btul ba la bstod pa /
analyzed: bdud btul ba la bstod pa /
translated: Praise of the Subjugation of MaraðŸ”½by the venerable Rabjor

original: rab dga'i lha'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: rab dga'i lha'i zhal snga nas mdzad pa rdzogs so//
